description: As a back-end developer, I am currently employed with the Mofid Online team, where my primary responsibilities include optimizing and maintaining existing code, as well as developing new features. I possess expertise in .NET Core, which enables me to develop high-performance and robust applications.

As a full-stack web developer, I am responsible for developing both the Angular frontend and NodeJS backend software for embedded kiosks devices utilized in various public settings, including universities, hospitals, and other public buildings. My primary objective is to ensure that the software is optimized for the kiosks' hardware and that it provides a seamless user experience.

I have created a highly secure and dependable identity server utilizing the cutting-edge technologies of IdentityServer4 and Skoruba Identity Server Admin. As part of my ongoing commitment to this project, I was engaged in enhancing the business logic of the APIs and optimizing the Angular frontend by reducing the number of API calls and minimizing load times. I continue my cooperation as a backup developer for the maintenance service. By doing so, I can ensure that this project remains sustainable and operationally sound, providing reliable identity services for years to come.

We developed a high-performance, real-time industrial platform called FaraWAMS. This platform is designed to effectively monitor and control power grid networks and SCADA systems, and it is a successor project to the Simpal v2. To optimize database performance, we utilize Apache Ignite in-memory database for managing real-time data, Microsoft SQL Server as the primary relational database, and MongoDB for archive data storage. The back-end is developed using .Net 6, and ReactJS is used for its front-end.

I am a former research graduate of the Iran University of Science and Technology, where I collaborated with the Universit√© Grenoble Alpes in France. My research endeavors have resulted in numerous scientific papers being published, with a particular focus on hardware security. One of my research projects involved investigating and identifying vulnerable points in high-level code during clock glitching attacks in RISC-V chips. Additionally, I aimed to identify sensitive code blocks in C/C++ language and their compiled assembly code. To accomplish this, we utilized various tools, including KLEE and LLVM for symbolic execution simulation, and the RISC-V simulator and Xilinx Vivado tool. Our efforts concluded in the publication of several papers in international journals and conferences, and we are proud to have contributed to the advancement of this field of study.

I was a back-end developer for Candle, a platform designed to promote sympathy and social connectivity. Candle bridges generational gaps and encourages empathy. My responsibilities included developing the ExpressJS and Swagger components of this project.

Our primary objective was to design and develop multi-level software using .Net for monitoring electrical and distribution substations in projects known as Simpal v1 and v2. In my role as a senior software developer, I was responsible for the back-end and front-end design of Simpal v2. Additionally, I worked with the software team to develop the user interface for Simpal v1. To enhance user experience, we incorporated user-friendly modules that featured real-time charts, allowing researchers to monitor archive power grid system data and plan new power station designs with ease. Our team is proud to have contributed to the successful delivery of these projects, which have been instrumental in advancing the field of electrical engineering.

During this period, I had the opportunity to develop numerous web-based projects for various individuals and companies. These projects included FNN, Noonnet, Restaurant Management System, and Neuro20EP, among others. For FNN, I implemented a responsive web design using modern front-end technologies such as ReactJS, HTML5, and CSS3. Additionally, I leveraged NodeJS and MongoDB for the back-end to ensure optimal performance and scalability.

My contributions to this company have included participation in multiple projects, such as the design of a graphical interface for an ultrasonic homogenizer device, the creation of a software interface for a 3D printer, and website development. Through my involvement in these projects, I have been able to leverage my expertise in software design and development. I take great pride in having played a role in delivering high-quality solutions that meet or exceed project requirements and expectations.
